title: Riot Does Literally Nothing Against Trolls (People who intentionally lose games)
body:
https://imgur.com/wX5m329

A Diamond game (of course in my series), where our jungler intentionally feeds and loses us the game because he wants to "demote his friends account because his friend was being mean to him". 

1. Hes account sharing. 
2. Hes inting. 
3. He was also toxic in game.

Punished? Nope! It was just a bad game no worries right Riot? If a person can play 18 games of intentionally wanting to lose the game without being punished, then its no wonder this game is getting more and more toxic players.

I hear that. At face value it seems simple, but its complicated.

To be clear, I do not care about chat behavior. Anything I say is ignoring that. Since we have a mute button, its completely irrelevant to address toxic chat as its a completely controllable issue. Toxic play is not.

Banning is programmatic because of a few different things, like having paid for items on an account. You also want to have some sort of multi-step system, like is currently in place, to encourage recovery. But recovery operates under the assumption that a player is invested in the game. That they like it enough to keep playing and 'reform'.


These are good ideas, but they don't actually solve the main issue.

The main issue currently is player frustration. Obviously. Next question, what are they frustrated about?

Trolls? Feeders? Smurfs... well yes- but there is a united deep root issue here.


Matchmaking.

We're frustrated because we try so hard, we're farming better, our awareness is vastly improved. We're tracking the jungler better, warding better, controlling waves better. We know what all of the champs do, we know when to pressure and when we can't- where to be when. We're working hard and learning.

Then here is my top and mid 0/6 in eight minutes, both of em. You're 2/0 as adc and wrecking this lane but you're in pretty deep shit. You know the 4 man bot is coming and your team can't do anything to stop it. Herald is about to drop top or bot, the game is fucked- and you can't do shit about it. All you can do is hope for a frustrating 40 minute game, or an early surrender that will NEVER happen with trolls. LOL RIOT, YOU FUNNY. Hopefully your teammates catch up, magically play better, the enemy team doesn't close, and you can pull something resembling a big W out of your asshole. Its not likely going to happen. 

I had this last game, and the game before that. In fact I've had that 6 games straight. Game quality is shit, super inconsistent. Certainly more consistantly bad than good.

Think of it this way, when was the last time you had a close game. Where you knew if you didn't play your very best you'd lose the fight and the game. Both teams were equal, no one was doing anything stupid- it was even. You felt like your teammates were as good as you, and same on the enemy team. Like... once in 30 games maybe. Its NOT common. At all.


Games simply aren't even. They aren't well matched. Game quality is poor. Damage is high right now, so its even worse than normal. The problem has been magnified.


Players in many cases aren't trolling on purpose. They actually don't KNOW their play is fucking their team. Which means they don't belong in the elo. Its not good for them, or other players, to slowly fall down the ladder losing games.

The ladder needs to start reacting to actual play instead of wins/losses. I don't know exactly how to make that work, but that is how you balance the ladder and get quality games. To even do that you have to get rid of smurfing by iding accounts, and using master account setups.

A lot of things need to be done in order to fix the system, but it can't be left to the wolves as it is currently.
